'Coelenterazine' is the luciferin, the light-emitting molecule, found in many
aquatic organisms across seven phyla. It is the substrate in many
luciferases and photoproteins including [[Renilla reniformis]] luciferase
(Rluc), Gaussia luciferase (Gluc), aequorin, and obelin.
